string.text: Oh, carne fresca ... ¿O te he visto antes, stalker? Soy el comerciante de este lugar. Si estas buscando una fuente de ingresos, siempre necesito a alguien dispuesto a hacer el trabajo sucio.\nCuido del campamento; todos los stalkers son bienvenidos aquí para descansar mientras se mantengan fuera de problemas. Te advierto, no te metas con los militares, pago un buen dinero para mantenerlos alejados de este lugar. Aqui los stalkers estan relativamente seguros siempre que no abandonen el campamento.
¡Oye, stalker! ¿Que necesitas?
¿Los negocios han concluido? Buen trabajo, aquí esta tu pago.
Tienes talento chico, ¿lo sabes no? Aqui tienes tu pago. Esto será bueno para los negocios.
Sidorovich, aquí esta la entrega de Hip, como se prometio. Ella confio en mi para traerte los artefactos, toma.

Ah, justo a tiempo. Toma, el pago de Hip. Dile que vaya a ver a Tabernero, y pronto, ella ha estado esperando ascender en el mundo, y esta es su oportunidad. Hay una entrega que debe hacerse desde el Bar a algun lugar más alla de la Barrera.
Gracias. Se lo dire. ¿Alguna vez ha pasado Hip por la barrera?

Hip lleva en la zona mucho, mucho tiempo. Vino con Libertad, pero no se quedo mucho despues de que se mudaron a los Almacenes Militares. Ella se ha estado quedando cerca de las fronteras como una novata desde entonces, desperdiciando años sin hacer nada. El trabajo de Tabernero la ayudará, de una forma u otra.
¿Que me puedes decir sobre los negocios de por aquí?

Para los meses de invierno, llegan muchas ordenes de la Gran Tierra solicitando pieles de pseudoperros. Si quieres ayudar a mantener caliente a una dama este invierno, vendeme las pieles en vez de algun cientifico.

Algunos idiotas de por aquí pagarian por cualquier cosa. He recibido multiples solicitudes de "dientes de chupasangre" - Si, si, lo se - eso viene de personas que creen que tener uno les dara buena suerte. Si claro. Un tonto y su dinero pronto se separan.

Los artefactos son pedidos por las personas menos esperadas. Algunos joyeros llegaron el otro dia en busca de flores de piedra. Bueno, ojala hayan hecho feliz a una dama, y ojala no se este muriendo por radiacion extrema en este momento.

Imaginate esto: hay un tio raro viajando por aquí que se presento como mi representante de ventas, ha usado mi reputacion y luego ha intentado entregar cosas de segunda categoria. Barriles rotos, trajes desmoronandose, productos enlatados caducados ... \nUna vez que sus clientes vinieron a mi bunker a quejarse, no tuve otra opción. Ahora, ese cabron duerme con los peces.

Un ex-Spetznaz solia andar por aquí como stalker libre. No me importó hasta que trató de reunir a una pandilla para asaltar mi operacion de contrabando. Afortunadamente no vivió lo suficiente para cumplir su objetivo.

Si alguien por aquí quiere ser comerciante, y no es parte de una facción importante, necesita verme y seguir mis reglas. He estado aquí desde el principio, y me encargare de los gilipollas que piensan que saben más que yo.
Te advierto: no gasto palabras con los que atacan a mis agentes. Si alguien ataca a alguien que conozco, acabo con ellos. Es tan simple como eso.

Antes ayudaba a manejar documentos militares sensibles y ayudaba a capturar especimenes mutantes excepcionalmente raros. Sin embargo, la gente de por aquí no parece estar interesada en eso en estos momentos.

Bueno, si quieres convertirte en stalker, vienes a mi primero. Puedo proporcionarte refugio, suministros y trabajo. Hay un puesto militar no muy lejos de aquí, pero hemos llegado a un acuerdo, jeje, por lo que generalmente no molestan a los stalkers aquí. Simplemente no los cabrees, ¿de acuerdo? Pago mucho dinero para mantenerlo así. De todos modos, ¿estas aquí por negocios? ¿Necesitas trabajo? Recuerda, me rascas la espalda y yo te rasco la tuya.
Eso es todo por ahora, ve a molestar a otro.
Hola stalker. ¿Qué te trae a la aldea hoy?

Soy el jefe. Muchos aventureros aspirantes vienen aquí con cestas de mimbre y mantas para un picnic, y, por supuesto, la Zona se los traga enteros. Malditos crios y hippies. Mi trabajo es asegurarme de que no se conviertan en almuerzo de mutante en su primer dia en este maravilloso lugar. No es facil, ¿sabes? Incluso con Fanatico ayudandome con a los novatos ... He pasado una buena parte de mi vida en la Zona. He trabajado con el legendario Strelok, hace tiempo. He viajado mucho, incluso he intentado irme un par de veces, pero siempre habia algo que me detenia: una incursion militar, otra emision o un trabajo rentable... Asi que, aquí estoy, todavia cuidando a los novatos.
Hola stalker, ¿como va todo?
¿Necesitas algo, stalker?
Tengo que encargarme de unos bandidos en el aparcamiento. Sidorovich me dijo que quizas quieras ayudarme.
Si, te ayudare. No quiero que mueran más novatos.

Mi nombre es Fanatico, por lo menos así es como me llaman. Basicamente soy el ayudante de Wolf aquí, en el campamento. Entreno a los novatos que llegan aquí. Ya sabes, enseñandoles a disparar con sus pistolas de mala calidad, diciendoles a donde pueden y no pueden ir, cazando mutantes, manteniendo a raya a los bandidos y los cabrones del ejercito. Hay mucho que hacer incluso aquí, tan cerca de la frontera de la Zona. Pero es agradable, ya sabes, especialmente cuando vuelven con su primer artefacto y ese brillo todavia en sus ojos. No me quejo.

Oye... no creo haberte visto por aquí antes. Pareces bastante nuevo. Soy uno de los encargados de este campamento, junto con Wolf. Si lo deseas, puedo enseñarte algunas cosas sobre la supervivencia en la Zona y asegurarme de que no mueras ante el primer mutante o anomalia que encuentres.
Sabes, en realidad podria necesitar un poco de ayuda. Estoy listo para aprender.
No gracias, aprenderé a mi propio ritmo.

Excelente. Primero, vamos a enseñarte como cazar mutantes. Hay una manada de jabalies al otro lado de la carretera. Ten en cuenta que los jabalies tienen craneos gruesos y cerebros diminutos, por lo que la mejor manera de lidiar con ellos es disparandoles desde un costado o, en un mundo perfecto, desde atras, a una distancia agradable y segura. Lo haremos juntos, pero trata de mantenerlos alejados de mi: estan en celo en esta epoca.
¡Uf, que locura! ¿Ahora que?
Bien hecho. Mira a ver si tu navaja es lo suficientemente fuerte como para despellejar los cuerpos. Cuando termines, vamos a la zona anomala más cercana.
Ya estamos, ¿que necesito hacer ahora?

A ver, este pozo esta lleno de anomalias gravitacionales. ¿Ves ese artefacto por alli? Eso es solo una hogaza de pan anomalo, ignoralo. Pero tambien en este pozo hay un Medusa, y los Medusas, junto con cualquier otro artefacto, tienen cualidades positivas y negativas... Es una suerte que haya uno aquí. Ahora, hablemos sobre el equipo que debes tener para la caza de artefactos.
Muestramelo.

Toma, un Eco Detector. Todos los detectores, mientras estan activos, registran la presencia de artefactos y miden la distancia al más cercano. Son un requisito básico para encontrar cualquier artefacto que no sea solo basura. Cuando escuchas un pitido, entonces sabes que un artefacto debe estar cerca. Cuanto más frecuentes son los pitidos, más cerca esta el artefacto. Desafortunadamente, este viejo modelo no puede detectar todos los artefactos, pero deberia estar bien para tu tarea de hoy. Mejores modelos tienen un mejor rango de detección y habilidades.
No esta mal.

Ahora la segunda herramienta, un contenedor de plomo. ¿Todavia recuerdas la charla sobre artefactos y sus caracteristicas positivas y negativas? Casi todos los artefactos que valen la pena transportar son radiactivos. El contenedor de plomo puede sellar completamente el artefacto en el interior, manteniendote a salvo de su radiación, pero tambien evita que uses sus otros efectos hasta que lo saques. Sin él, comenzarás a brillar como una perla y morirás en menos de unas pocas horas llevando incluso un solo artefacto. Es bastante pesado, pero es mejor prevenir que curar. Si realmente deseas utilizar un artefacto y aprovecharte de sus caracteristicas, es mejor hacerlo con un contenedor más avanzado, los cientificos los llaman "Modulos de aplicacion de artefactos" (AAM), que te protegeran de la radiación y te permitira aprovechar las caracteristicas del artefacto. Sidorovich lo suele tener en su inventario, pero generalmente guarda los AAM para stalkers más experimentados.
Bueno saberlo. Si que es muy pesado el contenedor de plomo. ¿Ahora que?

Lo siguiente es esta botella de vodka Nemiroff. Como te dije, casi todos los artefactos son radiactivos, e incluso si trajiste un Contenedor de Plomo, el campo de anomalias en si es radioactivo. Esta botella te ayudara a... eh... 'quitarte' algo de ese brillo causado por la radiacion, jeje.
Muy bien, ¿que más?

Oh si, los tornillos. Nunca te olvides de los tornillos antes de saltar dentro de los campos anomalos. Lanza un tornillo para encontrar el camino a traves de las anomalias. \nEso es todo. Vamos. Te cubriré desde aquí.
¡Ey, he conseguido el artefacto!
Mirate... Algun dia seras un stalker experimentado. Volvamos al campamento, continuaremos tu entrenamiento alli.
Eso seguro que fue algo...
¿Cansado? Parece que ahora te sabes lo básico, pero tengo un desafio adicional para cuando estes listo.
Estoy listo. ¿Cual es el desafio?

Dime, ¿que stalker nunca ha encontrado los secretos de otro? La zona es comun a todos aquí. Los que se lo curran, comen. A veces, encontrar un alijo no es solo un logro, sino una necesidad. He escondido un alijo en algun sitio del campamento, intenta encontrarlo.
Lo he encontrado... Gracias por el artefacto.

Eh... veo que con tu nivel de percepcion, la Zona no te consumira tan facilmente. Esa fue tu ultima lección. Realmente has demostrado ser un buen stalker, y deberias estar orgulloso de ello. No hay nada más que pueda enseñarte.
¿Y cual es nuestra tarea final?

Ya lo verás. Como saben, el más insidioso enemigo del hombre - extrañamente - sigue siendo un hombre. Durante mucho tiempo, hemos mantenido la estación de vehículos alejada de todos los bandidos, pero siguen volviendo. Han sido una amenaza constante, normalmente entre cinco y siete. Vamos a ocuparnos de ellos.
Ja, nosotros dos contra estos... ¡Somos unos héroes!
Lo que acabas de llamar heroísmo aquí es común para los stalkers más experimentados. De todos modos, volvamos al pueblo.
Gracias por cogerme bajo tu ala.

Gracias, aunque no soy el primero, ese honor es para Wolf. Necesito recuperar el aliento, eso me cansó... Oh, y tengo información sobre una ruta de Agroprom a Yantar en caso de que no hayas oído hablar de ella. Descansa un poco, y luego... Agh, ¿quién soy yo para decirte qué hacer? Ciertamente has demostrado ser tu propio stalker, y deberías estar orgulloso de ello. ¡Sé libre!

¿Algo para mí? He estado esperando esto. Spore me ayuda a mantener mis contactos en el exterior seguros y anónimos a través de una encriptación de alto nivel... Lo creas o no, solía ser un miembro de Cielo Despejado hace mucho tiempo, muchas cosas malas pasaron pero parece que de alguna manera se las arreglaron para unirse. La mayoría murieron o tomaron caminos separados. No le vi sentido a quedarme, pero aún conservo el contacto con Spore. Lo siento, lo olvidé. Aquí está tu pago:
Tengo algo para ti.
No estoy seguro de que tengas a la persona adecuada.
¿Puedes responder un par de preguntas?
Claro.
¿Cuánto falta para que mi pedido esté listo?
Depende de lo complejo que sea. Normalmente me lleva un día, a veces menos.
Cuéntame sobre ti.

No hay mucho que contar. Lo he tenido bueno y lo he tenido malo, como la mayoría de la gente. Me metí en algunas anomalías, fui rehén de bandidos... Llegué a la Zona joven, hace mucho tiempo. Al principio era una ardilla... anti-radios, munición perforante, ese tipo de cosas. Luego trabajé para Sidorovich... pagándole por salvarme el culo. Mientras sacaba castañas del fuego para él, hice algunas conexiones útiles y me independicé tan pronto como pude para empezar a entregar pedidos exclusivos. Hasta ahora he podido esquivar todo lo que la vida me ha lanzado, pero tengo la sensación de que mi suerte se está acabando. Al mismo tiempo, ya no tengo deseos de romperme el culo por centavos.
Gracias, ya veo.
Encantado de ayudar.
Estoy aquí para recoger mi pedido.

Aquí está tu Steppe Eagle. Resultó ser más difícil de lo que pensaba. Algún aficionado a las pistolas mostró mucho interés, pero apenas la cogí a tiempo. Compruébalo tu mismo: una pistola hecha a mano, los componentes se ajustan con una precisión inigualable. ¿Alguna vez te has preguntado cómo sería una pistola de francotirador perfecta? Bueno, esta es. Me debes 2.800 extra.
Bien, aquí tienes.
Ahí lo tienes. Un placer hacer negocios con usted.
No llevo tanto encima.
Bien, te guardaré el arma un rato. Espero que encuentres el dinero pronto.
No quiero comprar esto.
Si te niegas a recoger la orden, no podré confiar en usted la próxima vez. Tendré que incluir la estimación de riesgo en el precio y pedir un mayor adelanto.
Aún así, no voy a cobrar esta orden.
Está bien, como quieras.
Lo pensaré.
Claro, eso depende de ti. Te guardaré el arma un rato.
Aquí está tu Steppe Eagle de ultra alta precisión. Me debes 2.800 extra.

Contemplen el Alpine, una verdadera belleza. Pueden estar seguros de que esta pistola es única en toda la Zona. Un modelo único, de edición muy limitada, encargado para una sola unidad especial. No fue fácil de obtenerla, incluso tuve que involucrar a uno de mis socios en el extranjero. Un cargador expandido, un cañón de acero extra duro, un receptor hecho de polímeros extra fuertes. Añade 2.800 más y este bebé es suyo.
Aquí tienes tu pistola Alpine con un cargador ampliado. Añade los 2.800 restantes y este bebé es tuyo.

Mira, esto es March. La pistola pertenecía a un mercenario llamado Wolfhound. Un francotirador compacto de alto calibre con un retroceso corto y un rayolaser. Wolfhound era cien por ciento escoria, pero conocía sus armas, hay que reconocerlo. Dicen que su truco favorito era volarle los miembros a sus víctimas y luego la cabeza, antes de que cayeran al suelo. De todos modos, son 2.800.
Aquí está su pistola de rápida March. Me debes 2.800 extra.

Aquí tienes... La Cutter, una subametralladora. Déjame decirtelo de una vez, no te preocupes por la apariencia. Es un modelo nuevo, no está en producción en serie todavía. Es un prototipo, recién salido de la armería. El objetivo de los diseñadores era hacer un arma de corto alcance de nueva generación: una combinación de alto calibre, fuego rápido y precisión. Así que serán 8.000 más.
Sí, aquí está La Cutter, una subametralladora de fuego rápido. Son 8.000 extra.

Aquí hay un buen ejemplar - Una Carabineer. Una verdadera escopeta del ejército. Capaz de disparar automáticamente y de proporcionar un buen anti-retroceso gracias a un sistema equilibrado y libre de atascos. Añade 8.000 y es tuya.
Aquí está, La Carabineer, una escopeta automática. Añade 8.000 y es tuya.

I reckon this is just what you need. Eliminator, a latest development. The whole batch was supposed to be shipped to Central Africa, but I got a 'sample' as a special favour from friends. An automatic shotgun with a large magazine and an excellent rate of fire. Yours for only 8,000.
Sure. Automatic shotgun Eliminator, with an extended magazine. For 8,000.

Sure. Behold Storm, a submachine and grenade launcher in one. This prototype is a modified version of a conventional weapon designed for special units operating in the Zone. Technical innovation a its best from our Slavic brothers... Add 16,000 and it's yours.
Sure. Here's Storm, a submachine and grenade launcher with an extended magazine, for an extra 16,000.

Here it is - GP37, a new-generation assault rifle. Accurate, reliable, and convenient with a built-in optical scope. It was previously owned by a UN observer. Their group was sent to the Zone to investigate. However, the situation turned for the worse... 16,000 and the rifle is yours.
Here it is - GP37, a new-generation assault rifle. The price is 16,000.

Just a sec. Here's a modular FT-200M rifle, the brainchild of Belgian gunmakers. Accurate, all-purpose, handy for both righties and lefties, comes with an optical scope and a grenade launcher. I got it from some unlucky UN observers... That'll be 16,000 extra.
Here's a modular FT-200M rifle. That'll be 16,000 extra.

Here's Tide. Based on a silent sniper rifle, it was specifically designed for military units to fight zombies. Tide yields rate of fire in favour of stopping power, allowing the sniper to pick off zombies one by one without disclosing his location. However, it then became clear that stalkers alone will be enough to stop zombies a the Barrier, so the rifle never reached máss production. This baby's yours for an extra 16,000.
Here's Tide, a silent sniper rifle with increased stopping power. Add an extra 16,000 and enjoy.

Here. This is an SVU2-A, a short sniper rifle with an increased rate of fire. I bought it off Mac, the legendary Freedom guard. He swore there are no others like it in the whole Zone. It's an exclusive item, a least in these parts. It'll be 16,000 extra.
Yeah. SVU2-A, a short sniper rifle with an increased rate of fire. It'll be 16,000 extra.

Sure, just look a Lynx here. Hand-crafted by a local expert. He's deceased now, so there won't be any copies. It looks just like any other rifle, but take it out for some target practice and you'll feel all the difference. It's got a perfect combination of accuracy and stopping power. Add the remaining 16,000 and this baby's yours.
Yeah, Lynx - a sniper rifle with increased accuracy and power. Add 16,000 and it's yours.

Look here. I managed to get everything off my list - a CS-3a with a helmet. The helmet is nothing special on its own, but it allows for installing a mobile tactical complex, which includes a high-quality night vision system and an active infrared sensor. Now, the CS-3a armour is a real beauty. Excellent protection from bullets and anomalies is a rare feature indeed in a suit as light and mobile as this one. The whole thing will cost you 32,000.
Yeah. A set of CS-3a armour with a tactical helmet. 32,000 in all.

Specially for you, a SEVA suit. Everything just like you ordered - a closed-cycle respiratory module, thermal resistant, protective electrical circuit, and outer-surface anti corrosion materials. Plus several built-in artefact containers as a bonus. A must-have suit for any stalker. Toss in 24,000 like we agreed and it's yours.
Here. A SEVA suit. The price is 24,000, like we agreed.

There it is, a combat exoskeleton as large as life. The best protection you can get in the Zone from bullets, claws or grenade fragments, with the exception of armoured vehicles. But it also takes after armoured vehicles in that it relieves your weight burden - within reason, of course. 48,000 and it's yours, warts and all... err... by that I mean batteries and servomotors.
There it is, a combat exoskeleton as large as life. 48,000 and it's yours.
I want to place an order.
No hay problema. ¿Que necesitas?
A pistol.
Of course. It'll be 3,500, of which I will require an advance payment of 700.
Bien, aquí tienes.
I'll get in touch with you as soon as the order is ready.
I don't have the money on me.
Well, please come back when you've got the cash.
You know, I've changed my mind.
Fine. If you finally decide to make an order, I'm always here.
You're not a very reliable customer, so the pistol will cost you 4,200. And I will require an advance payment of 1,400.
I'm afraid the best pistols have already sold out. If you want the regular stuff, Búho's the man to see.
A close-range weapon.
Sure thing. The price is 10,000, and I'll need 2,000 of that in advance.
You refused to pick up your last order... So this one will cost you 12,000, and I'll need 4,000 of that in advance.
Hrm... You know, I probably can't help you there. The demand is too high.
An assault weapon.
Something high-calibre and with rapid fire capability, okay... The regular price is 20,000, with a 4,000 advance payment. What do you say?
You're a tough customer. I'll have to charge you 24,000 and I need 8,000 paid in advance. Deal?
Right now is a bad time... the military are making things hot a the Cordon. Someone attacked their outpost the other day, which made them even more difficult to deal with.
A sniper weapon.
For you I can get the best for only 20,000, but you'll have to pay me 4,000 in advance.
Working with you entails a certain amount of risk... I can try to arrange your order for 24,000, but you'll need to make a 8,000 down payment.
Sorry, this type of weapon is hard to come by right now. My contact for sniper stuff is... let's say he's indisposed.
An armoured suit.
Yeah, I can think of something... suitable. It'll cost you 40,000, but you'll have to pay me 8,000 in advance.
Yeah, I can think of something... suitable. You refused to collect your last order, so the price will be 48,000 and you'll have to pay me 16,000 in advance.
I won't be able to do any better than the last suit I got for you. That one was both unique and top of the line.
A suit with a closed-cycle respiratory module.
That's a tall order... Won't be easy to obtain, not by a long shot. I can try to get one of these babies for 30,000, but I have to ask for a down payment of 6,000.
You let me down on the last order, so I have to think twice this time. I can try to get one of these babies for 36,000, but I have to ask for a down payment of 12,000.
I bent over backwards to get the last one. Don't think I'll be able to repeat that.
An exoskeleton.

You must have given this choice a lot of thought. I can get my hands on a combat version, but it'll cost you 60,000. Expensive, I know, but well worth it. Keep in mind I'll need 12,000 of that paid right now.
You didn't treat me very nicely on the last order, so this one'll set you back 72,000. Keep in mind I'll need 24,000 of that paid right now.
No way. Since they closed the manufacturing plant, vacant exoskeletons are typically found only on corpses... That's just not my method.
Nothing right now.
Sorry, my shop is closed a the moment. Temporary difficulties with order shipments...

Hello. I'm Nimble. People come to me for unique weapons. Rare models, prototypes, unique shooters - stuff like that. Plus elite equipment, the latest modifications of protective and combat suits. I check every item personally, so quality is guaranteed.
Hello. Would you like to place an order?
Hola.
Tu pedido será entregado muy pronto.
The order is finished. Please come to collect it.
¿Quien eres?
Oh, I work as the technician here a the checkpoint.
What do they call you?
No need for formality and ranks - not on the parade ground, a least. In case of any attack, my name would be too long to pronounce. Name's Sergey, though I prefer Seryoga.
Nice to meet you, Seryoga.
Likewise. If you need anything fixed up, just let me know.
What's the current situation?
Nothing interesting. There's a stalker village a bit to the north... Nothing but hostiles all the way up to Agroprom.
So... we're stuck here and in danger of being attacked a any moment?
Nah, everyone knows there'd be hell to pay if anyone messes with this checkpoint directly. We're like a sleeping bear that no one wants to poke too hard.
I'll keep that in mind.
I need a heli. Is this possible to organize?
It is, but we won't be using up fuel just for you. You'll have to prove that you're worth the lift.
To which places do you offer transport?
To our base in Agroprom for five thousand rubles, as well as the gas station in the Darkscape for three thousand and the mobile lab a lake Yantar for ten thousand.
I could use a lift.
Where to?
To the military base in Agroprom. %c[d_orange][5000 RU]
To the gas station in the Darkscape. %c[d_orange][3000 RU]
To the mobile lab in Yantar. %c[d_orange][10000 RU]
He cambiado de opinion.
Been better days, what do you need?
I'd like to ask you some questions.

There's not much I can tell you, unless you're looking for work. I know a guy. He's rich, but clueless. He's out there, treating the Zone like a safari right now. He doesn't care for artefacts. All he wants to do is collect old guns...and shoot pigs with said guns. Told me he wanted a scoped TOZ that has "seen some genuine Zone action" as a souvenir. Naturally, what he's willing to pay is absolutely through the roof! Problem is, I haven't seen a scoped TOZ in the Zone since 2012. Certainly, none of the major traders below the Barrier seem to stock one. But if you find one, bring it to me along with 20 rounds of buckshot and you'll be paid several times what it'd fetch you elsewhere.
Sounds like a good deal to me. I'll do it.
Not interested right now, sorry.
Give me this tourist's details or you're dead.
Sounds like a good deal to me. I'll do it.
Here. Delivered as promised.
Bad news I'm afraid. Our client died. Horribly. Don't look so sour though! His lack of survival skills were surpassed only by his lack of discretion. Here's some things from his stash.
Damn...so he died? Just like that?

Pseudogiant, from what I can tell. Speaking of, would you mind picking up a can of tuna for me? It's just the right size, and I'm sure his next of kin will want the remains back in some sort of container.
What the hell...? I mean, if I happen to find a tuna can...maybe I'll let you know. Cheers.
His stash contents aren't going to cut it, Hip. Either cough up the dough, or cough up some blood.
Here, Hip. I found a can for you.
MMm, the tuna is delicious! Hopefully I'll keep it down when collecting what's left of our late client.
I'd like to ask you some questions.
And I might have some answers.
Do you have any general knowledge? On how to survive? Anomalies? Anything like that?

Firstly, never dig straight down. Secondly, aim for the lower neck. Thirdly, don't eat the yellow snow. Fourthly, taxes aren't actually certain here - consider it a Zone-Wide anomaly. Finally, don't panic.
That was...enlightening?
Do you usually take on collection jobs?

Yeah. Ever heard of Nimble? Damn inspiring story behind that man. I used to be a drug mule for Freedom, but then started thinking "Nah man, I'm not going to be busting my ass for pennies either"! So here I am, trying to follow in his footsteps.
That's...certainly ambitious. Why aren't you seeking him out?
Because I'm not crazy enough to go past the Barrier just yet, that's why. Money's only good if you live to spend it, you know?
Okay, then why are you hanging out in the Rookie Village?

Because Sidorovich knows literally everyone worth knowing in this little slice of hell. You want to start your own business? You better get in good with Sid first if you don't want hitmen on your ass.
You ever had hitmen on your ass?

Duty's never been fond of anyone who dresses in green flecktarn, although laying low for a few years seems to have stopped that. There's also the occasional man who takes rejection a little too personally.
What, they'd try to kill you for not being their little doll?
Worse. Luckily, the number of decent people here is larger than I thought. Still, life doesn't last long here for most. I could do with a few new friends.
I bet you say that to every stalker who brings you a can of tuna.
Oh, please. You know how hard it is to watch out for Bloodsuckers when it's just you on your lonesome? It's a lot harder than it looks, I promise you.
Are you planning on going somewhere then?

Yeah. I've got some routine artefact runs to do. I've got a special order to fill sometime too - you can come with for that, if you like. Need someone to watch out for Bloodsuckers after all. You'd get a nice cut. Fifty percent should be more than fair.
Alright, count me in.
No no, I'll leave you to it. Maybe I'll join you on another expedition.

Great! Sidorovich has a special order for a Moonlight, a Fireball and a Wrenched. These aren't easy to find, so there's no real time limit to it - but the sooner, the better. I want to build a good rep for dependability, after all.
Alright, let's get started then!
Here's the fifty percent as agreed. I'm certain someone else would've paid much more.
Probably. But what we've definitely done is stick to our word. We've made a nice sum out of this, I'm happy.
Could you carry this medkit for me?
What? Why would I need to carry a medkit for you? If you can't apply it yourself, you're probably too dead for me to save.
Just in case. Trust me.
You know...that's a good point.
Eh, alright. I'll trust you.
That's an unusual ethos for someone in Freedom armour. Even if they are only an ex-Freedomer.

Most of Freedom's early members were friends of mine, and I sort of joined up for that reason. I didn't really like the turn their ideology had taken though, or what their faction was becoming. I wanted an adventure with friends. I didn't want to be part of some person's excuse to wage war.
Come with me to the campfire. I have some good news for you.
Sidorovich wanted me to tell you something. He secured you a delivery job with Barkeep...problem is that it requires going past the Barrier.

Thank you for letting me know. An old friend just dropped me a PDA message, saying something similar. Look, come back here tonight, alright? I need some time to mentally prepare myself for the journey. I'm also still going to need you to watch out for Bloodsuckers for this job, so don't take too long coming back.
Hip, it is time. You ready to go check out Barkeep's job?

I'm not so sure. The message I got earlier...it was from Lukash. He urgently needs an extra hand for a medicine run to their base in Yanov. I know what I said about Freedom earlier, but we both know it's not just them who'll benefit from that.

Lukash will probably find someone else to do the run. Barkeep occupies one of the most central points in the Zone - grabbing his job while it's still available would be better for you in the long run.
In that case, we should get to Lukash to pick up the meds as soon as possible - every second could save a life.
Hm, yeah, you're right. Freedom can find someone else to be their mule. Barkeep it is. Let's get going while the going is good.

Glad you agree. From what I hear, the Freedom leader a Yanov runs a tight ship. Doing this favour for Lukash would save more lives than whatever Barkeep had in mind. Ready to head to the Warehouses when you are.
Do you have any idea where we can find the artefacts Sidorovich wants?
Of course. Moonlights can be found in Electro anomalies, Wrenched in Vortex anomalies and Fireballs in the Burner anomalies.
Alright. And I suppose I'll stand guard while you dive into them?
Actually, I will stand guard. You can dive into them.
Aren't you supposed to be the artefact hunter?
I told you where to find them, didn't I? Besides, it'd be more fun for you this way.
Hey, Hip? Do you know any stories?

Yeah, I do actually. Ever heard of Yuri Semetsky? He was famous for dying a least once per day on the Stalker Network. Probably just a glitch, but some say Yuri was one of the first Stalkers to ever reach the Wish Granter. Ever. Rumour was he wished for immortality. The result was him dying, only to resurrect somewhere else a random up to 24 hours or less before his next unavoidable death. Some of his obituaries were really awful. As beautiful as the Zone can be, it holds some dark things best left unexplored.
And do you know why Yuri's deaths are no longer reported on the network?

Not exactly, but I've speculated. I find it interesting that his deaths stopped reporting shortly after a Stalker named "Marked One" shut off the Brain Scorcher and reached the NPP. I have no clue what went down there, but things definitely changed. Whatever happened, it seems Yuri is now free to remain dead in peace.
You don't think he could still be alive?
Maybe, but I'm not sure what sort of life that would be now. Perhaps he continues as some sort of ghost? I could not say. Stranger things have happened.
Hey, Hip! Carry this detector for me, would you?
Just what I needed - yet another expensive machine that goes "beep".
What happens next in the future of Hip?

You know, I've been thinking things over in my travels with you. Maybe it isn't the right time for me to settle down and start my own business yet. Thought it was what I wanted, but in truth I was just afraid. What I really want is to adventure. I realize now that there's still so much to explore.
What about following in Nimble's footsteps?

So I can do nothing but sit on a boat all day? Maybe that's how I felt before, but look a this place. How can you bear to sit inside all the time knowing what's out here? I'm not ready for the quiet life.
It's mostly death out here.
Yet here you are, out here, almost every day.
What do you mean?
It's difficult to describe, but I think I can be happy here. The Zone really is a miracle, and I'd like to see more of it.
So you're sure you will choose the life of a field stalker over that of a trader? Even once you have the money and connections to settle down?
Yes, I'm sure. Maybe once I'm old and fat like Sidorovich I'll change my mind.
You're being rash about this. Think it over some more.
I already have. I've made my decision. I was hoping you'd be more supportive of it.
Alright, then maybe stick around. It'll be good to have someone watch out for bloodsuckers.
Hah! I thought so myself! Here, take this as thanks. You've come through for me more times than anyone'd care to count.
Guess that's what teams do, isn't it? Let's go.
Hip, I think it's best if we part ways for now.
Are you sure?
Yeah. You go do you. There is something I must deal with alone.
Nah. Just pulling your leg.
Alright. I'll drop by the Rookie Village every now and then, so maybe I'll meet you there? Just, whatever you do, come back alive please.
It's good to see you again Hip. Would you like to join me for another journey into the Zone?
You only needed to ask.
Hip: Alright, let's go to the village campfire then. Can't wait to hear it!
Good luck on your mission, stalkers. Keep your wits about you.
Hip: I wouldn't worry too much about the other job, I'm sure someone else is handling it by now.
Barbas seems pleased with his service, and this wasn't exactly the safest of courier jobs. Stay alive and this could be the start of a good business relationship.
Hip: Hey, guess you were right about getting in good with Barkeep first!
Hip: I know it isn't always easy doing something just out of the goodness of your heart.
Hip: So really, thank you. You've probably helped make a world of difference for Yanov.
